title: Clean energy is poised for growth in the new industrial age - Inhabitat
summary: The clean energy industry is growing rapidly and is expected to be worth hundreds of billions of dollars per year by 2030. The growth of clean energy is being driven by the need to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and to address the risks of climate change. However, the clean energy industry faces some challenges, including supply chain disruptions, the dominance of China in the production and trade of clean energy technologies, and the concentration of mining for rare minerals and metals in a small number of countries.

green_process: TRUE, the article describes the development of processes that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.

title: How is Swancor Developing Toward the Future? - AZoM
summary: Swancor is a chemical manufacturing company that develops and sells environmentally friendly and green energy materials. The company has recently developed a revolutionary, innovative product, the recyclable thermoset resin "EzCiclo," which provides a new and effective solution to the previously unsolvable recycling problem. Swancor is exhibiting at JEC World 2023, the largest composite materials exhibition in Europe and the world, to showcase its latest products and services and to understand its customers' short, medium, and long-term plans.
green_innovation: TRUE - Swancor's recyclable thermoset resin "EzCiclo" is a green innovation because it contributes to environmental sustainability by providing a new and effective solution to the previously unsolvable recycling problem. This product reduces negative environmental externalities of human activity by making it possible to recycle thermoset composites without generating waste solvents, emissions, or pollution.
business_innovation: TRUE - Swancor's recyclable thermoset resin "EzCiclo" is a business product innovation because it is a new product that differs significantly from the firm's previous products and has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE - Swancor's recyclable thermoset resin "EzCiclo" is a green product because it is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle. This product is recyclable, reusable, safe, and has a wide range of applications.

title: Beyond Trees: Using Blue-Green Algae for Natural Carbon Capture and Sequestration - TriplePundit
summary: Cyanobacteria blooms are a common occurrence in bodies of water, but they can be harmful to the environment and human health. However, researchers have found that cyanobacteria can be used to create a bio-manufactured brick that can help to capture carbon dioxide. This process could help to offset the cost of remediating blue-green algae blooms and could also be used to create a more sustainable building material.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the innovation contributes to environmental sustainability goals by reducing carbon dioxide emissions and providing a more sustainable building material.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the innovation is a new product (bio-manufactured brick) that differs significantly from the company's previous products and has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE, because the bio-manufactured brick is designed to reduce carbon dioxide emissions and is made from a renewable resource (cyanobacteria).
green_process: TRUE, because the process of creating the bio-manufactured brick uses cyanobacteria to capture carbon dioxide and does not produce any harmful emissions.

title: Delta Electronics' Americas Headquarters Becomes First LEED Zero Energy-Certified Green Building in Fremont ... - Automation.com
summary: Delta Electronics' Americas HQ has achieved LEED Zero Energy certification, making it the first green building in Fremont, California to do so. The building generates as much electricity as it consumes through the use of solar PV systems and a battery storage system. Delta's own IoT-based Smart Green Solutions were used to upgrade the building, including an energy storage system, a data center cooling solution, and a building control platform.

title: Top U.S. clean energy trends to watch in 2023 - Inhabitat
summary: 2023 is expected to be a turning point in the clean energy revolution, with solar and wind energy becoming cheaper to produce than traditional energy and municipalities investing heavily in a clean energy future. Key trends to watch include the skyrocketing sales of electric vehicles, the increasing popularity of offshore wind farms, and significant government investment in clean energy legislation. While political instability remains a challenge, the Inflation Reduction Act is providing substantial incentives for the development and adoption of clean energy technologies.

title: Who's Who guide to 'green' Irish business - Irish Examiner
summary: Greenhouse gas emissions decreased by 4% in 2022 in Ireland from power generation and industrial companies covered by the EU Emissions Trading Scheme. title: Energy Transition in Canada â€“ Pathway to the 2050 Energy System - EY
summary: Decarbonizing to avert climate crisis is a massive undertaking in which Canada has an important role to play due to our work with disclosures and clean technologies. 5 key actions can help Canada ease the energy transition: (1) defining the future energy system, (2) improving public policy and regulatory frameworks, (3) developing a funding mechanism, (4) educating and guiding consumer behaviour, and (5) activating corporate participation. Decarbonization targets will be near-impossible to achieve without technology and innovation, humans at the centre of change, and partnering through collaboration and sponsorships.

title: Shashi Amin, CEO - Cable Solutions at APAR Industries Limited - Energetica India
summary: APAR Industries Limited, a leading manufacturer of renewable and specialty cables, is committed to sustainability and innovation. The company offers a range of green products and processes, including solar and wind power cables, EV wiring solutions, and a new CCV line for elastomeric cables. title: B.C.'s largest coastline cleanup gets major funding boost | BC Gov News - BC Gov News
summary: The Clean Coast, Clean Waters Initiative Fund, a program of the British Columbia government, is investing an additional $25 million in one-time funding to support projects that protect and restore the province's marine environment. The funding will be used to remove derelict vessels and clean up marine debris from shorelines, and will create well-paying jobs. The Coastal First Nations-Great Bear Initiative will receive $4 million of the funding, and the remaining $21 million will be awarded to successful funding applicants through a merit-based assessment process.
